info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 10 at 2:07AM EST until November 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College PA
info.description:
* WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Accumulations of 6 inches or more possible.
* WHERE...Warren County.
* WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 1 PM EST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be light snow during the day today with accumulations of 1 to 3 inches by sunset. However, the majority of snowfall is expected to fall between Monday night and late Tuesday morning.
info.instruction:
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

parameter.value: LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY
